At Bat's Ask At Bat: Stats Leaders
description:
IAB-15657
As a user I would like to be able to ask At Bat to answer specific baseball stats queries such as:
Who led the league in ERA in 1975?
Who is the all time AL Steals Leader?
Who holds the single season record for On Base percentage?

- The user should press a microphone button which would open up a sheet with a "capturing indicator" like Siri (a waveform animation indicating that it is listening)
- As the user speaks, we would show text to translation
- The answer would be provided with a link to the correct view in Stats to get a deeper answer
- Error handling would be provided if it doesn't understand the query

IAB-16718
Ask At Bat should be able to process any deep link returned by the bot service. While some custom work to handle stats deep links has been done to allow those links the be processed in a custom manner, we need to ensure any deep links returned by the service can be handled by Ask At Bat by directing the user to the page indicated in the link.

Wiki:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=mobile&title=At+Bat+-+Question+Bot+-+Phase+1
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=SD&title=Stats+Leaders
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=55312411
http://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/teams?sportId=1 (Team IDs)

Designs:
iOS - https://app.zeplin.io/project/59a72cd508f6e486f47ebd54
Android - https://app.zeplin.io/project/59a72cba458184fde6e5c524

name: FaceBook Messenger: Player Stats_EDIT ALL
At Bat's Ask At Bat: Game States
description:
SDBB-409
STORY
As an end user I want to get information about any team when asked in the Ask At Bat interface.
DETAILS
When a user requests a team in the At Bat bot client (thus a gameinfo intent), return a team page deep link.
Example utterances:
How are the Yankees doing?
What is the score of the Yankees game?
When is the next Yankees game?
Who pitches for the Yankees tomorrow?
It is important to note here that regardless of the details of the utterance, Bambot (and thus At Bat) will simply push the user to the team page, largely in the hope that the desired data is present.

IAB-16718
Ask At Bat should be able to process any deep link returned by the bot service. While some custom work to handle stats deep links has been done to allow those links the be processed in a custom manner, we need to ensure any deep links returned by the service can be handled by Ask At Bat by directing the user to the page indicated in the link.

Wiki:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=SD&title=Stats+Leaders
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=mobile&title=At+Bat+-+Question+Bot+-+Phase+1

Designs:
iOS - https://app.zeplin.io/project/59a72cd508f6e486f47ebd54
Android - https://app.zeplin.io/project/59a72cba458184fde6e5c524

name: At Bat's Ask At Bat: Player Name Recognition
description:
SDBB-446

As an end user I would like to ask [bot client name] about a baseball player and get information back.

DESCRIPTION
The purpose of this feature is to support player name recognition for BAMBots, enabling users to send voice or text queries about player stats, bios, starting appearances (pitchers), and DL statuses.

This feature can be addressed in two phases, with the initial implementation intended for At Bat.

Deep link
- Successfully recognized queries will be returned a player card webview deeplink for Ask At Bat. This is the minimum acceptable experience, with all player queries returning the same result.
